alert.note: Alert for Creek; Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 6:58PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Creek, Okmulgee and Okfuskee Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 658 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Boley, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Okemah... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Morris... Beggs... Boley... Schulter... Paden... Grayson... Bearden... Castle... Clearview... Preston... Bald Hill... Okmulgee State Park... Welty... Pharoah... Mason... Hectorville... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 212 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
